quest.transport.train.steam_engine.subti: Obtained by looting or sequenced assembly.
quest.transport.train.heat_engine.subtit: Obtained by looting or sequenced assembly.
quest.transport.train.precision_mechanis: Obtained by looting or sequenced assembly.
quest.transport.train.train_casing.descr: The train casing is used in many train-related blocks. Craft one by using a sturdy sheet on a brass casing.
quest.transport.train.train_control.desc: The train controller allows you to actually control your train. Place a seat, sit in it and right click the controller to start driving.
quest.transport.train.train_station.subt: For all your train scheduling needs
quest.transport.train.train_station.desc: The train station allows you to assemble your train, among other things. Ponder it with [w] to get a more detailed tutorial!
quest.transport.train.train_tracks.subti: Obtained by looting or sequenced assembly.
quest.transport.train.train_tracks.descr: Alternatively, try to restore the existing railway system for fast travel!
quest.transport.train.train_assembly.des: Successfully assemble a train using the train station.
quest.transport.train.train_fuel.title: Train Fueling
quest.transport.train.train_fuel.subtitl: Steam power comes in the next patch
quest.transport.train.train_fuel.descrip: Trains require fuels such as coal placed in chests or barrels on them to be able to move.
quest.transport.car.subtitle: Reinventing the wheel.
quest.transport.car.engine.title: Engine
quest.transport.car.engine.subtitle: Not quite a V12... but it'll do.
quest.transport.car.engine.desc_1: The engine required is different depending on the vehicle you plan to make, so check the crafting recipe!
quest.transport.car.engine.desc_2: The engine also determines the speed and acceleration of the vehicle - different vehicles will have different performances.
quest.transport.car.crafter.title: Your First Car
quest.transport.car.crafter.subtitle: What do you mean I can't craft them by hand?
quest.transport.car.crafter.desc_1: Most vehicle parts must be crafted using Create's sequenced assembly, as well as mechanical crafters. It is recommended that you famillarize yourself with how they work!
quest.transport.car.crafter.desc_2: Alternatively, vehicles can spawn in various states of disrepair in the cities, waiting to be restored.
quest.transport.car.car.title: Cars and Bikes
quest.transport.car.car.subtitle: Unfortunately, drifting has been removed due to excessive fatalities.
quest.transport.car.car.desc_1: A wide variety of vehicles can be made, ranging from sports cars to trucks to motorcycles.
quest.transport.car.car.desc_2: They all perform differently, and have different fuel tank sizes and speeds, so experiement to find out what works best for your playstyle.
quest.transport.car.car.desc_3: All vehicles come with built-in storage space, accessible through the vehicle's inventory or by shift-clicking.
quest.transport.car.repair.title: Vehicle Repair
quest.transport.car.repair.desc_1:
Vehicles can be repaired by placing iron or steel ingots into the ingot slot in the car's inventory. Multiple ingots will be required!
Steel is more efficient, but is harder to acquire.
quest.transport.car.repair.desc_2: Watch your vehicle health carefully, vehicles will explode if they reach 0 health with fuel inside!
quest.transport.car.recharge.title: Vehicle Recharging
quest.transport.car.recharge.desc_1: Vehicles can be recharged by placing charged batteries into the battery slot in the car's inventory.
quest.transport.car.recharge.desc_2: The vehicle's battery will also slowly recharge as long as the engine is running.
quest.transport.car.fuels.title: Car Refueling
quest.transport.car.fuels.subtitle: Mmm… the smell of gasoline.
quest.transport.car.fuels.desc_1: All vehicles support being refueled with biodiesel, diesel, or gasoline.
quest.transport.car.fuels.desc_2: Gasoline is the most efficient fuel for vehicles, followed by diesel, and then biodiesel.
quest.transport.car.canisters.title: Gas Canisters
quest.transport.car.canisters.desc_1: Vehicles can be refueled by placing canisters full of the appropriate fuel type into the fuel slot in the car's inventory.
quest.transport.car.canisters.desc_2: Keep in mind buckets of fuel do not work - Only canisters full of fuel will be accepted.
quest.transport.car.gasstation.title: Gas Stations
quest.transport.car.gasstation.desc_1: The gas station block allows for refueling cars without having to use canisters. To use it, park a vehicle nearby, select it in the gas station's menu, and click the square button.
quest.transport.car.gasstation.desc_2: The gas station can be refueled using canisters, or by pumping gas using pipes into the sides of the block. Only the sides will accept pipes!
quest.transport.car.bodies.title: Body
quest.transport.car.bodies.subtitle: Keeping it all together.
quest.transport.car.bodies.desc_1: Vehicle frames primarily use steel, aluminum and duroplast.
quest.transport.car.wheels.title: Wheels
quest.transport.car.wheels.subtitle: The wheels on the bus go round and round...
quest.transport.car.wheels.desc_1: Wheels are made using aluminium and rubber.
quest.transport.car.wheels.desc_2: There are two kinds of wheels, so be sure to check which kind your car uses!
quest.transport.planes.engine.title: Aircraft Engine
quest.transport.planes.engine.subtitle: Take to the sky!
quest.transport.planes.engine.desc_1: This modpack contains two different plane mods, Immersive Aircraft and Simple Planes.
quest.transport.planes.engine.desc_2: However, both mods use a common engine block to power their aircraft.
quest.transport.planes.engine.desc_3: Feel free to check the entries for the respective aircraft to have a better understanding of which one is more suitable for you!
quest.transport.planes.sp_upgrades.title: Simple Planes Upgrades
quest.transport.planes.sp_upgrades.desc_: The upgrades for Simple Planes can be installed by right-clicking them onto a completed aircraft.
Right-clicking on the aircraft with a wrench will bring up the upgrade window, which allows you to remove upgrades.
Each aircraft can hold up to 6 upgrades (including the engine!).
quest.transport.planes.shooter_upgrade.d: Allows the plane to shoot. Uses arrows.
Fire the weapon with left-click when seated in the plane.
quest.transport.planes.seat_upgrade.desc: Increases the number of players that can sit in your aircraft.
quest.transport.planes.rocket_booster.de: Increases the aircraft's maximum throttle speed.
quest.transport.planes.solar_panel.title: Solar Panel Upgrade
quest.transport.planes.solar_panel.desc_: Allows the aircraft to charge passively when there's sunlight, if the aircraft has an electric engine.
quest.transport.planes.shulker_shell.des: Automatically returns the aircraft to your inventory when you exit it.
quest.transport.planes.armor.title: Plane Armor Upgrade
quest.transport.planes.armor.desc_2: ...Did you know you can use Protection Upgrade Parts on your plane?
quest.transport.planes.floaty.title: Floaty Bedding Upgrade
quest.transport.planes.floaty.desc_1: Allows your plane to float on the water surface.
quest.transport.planes.supplycrate.title: Supply Crate
quest.transport.planes.supplycrate.desc_: Allows your plane to have an inventory, accessible using [I] while seated.
Also allows your plane to drop an airdrop using [C].
quest.transport.planes.liquid_engine.des: Runs off liquid fuels like biodiesel or even lava, accessible using [I] while seated.
The liquid engine is a mandatory upgrade that must be installed into the aircraft with right-click.
quest.transport.planes.electric_engine.d: Allows the plane to be charged with FE. Needs a charging pad to function.
The electric engine is a mandatory upgrade that must be installed into the aircraft with right-click.
quest.transport.planes.furnace_engine.de: Runs off solid fuel such as coal, coal coke, or wood, accessible using [I] while seated.
The furnace engine is a mandatory upgrade that must be installed into the aircraft with right-click.
quest.transport.planes.workbench.title: Plane Workbench
quest.transport.planes.workbench.desc_1:
The plane workbench is used to craft Simple Planes aircraft. It requires propellors and wood planks. 
The wood planks you choose determines the style of your aircraft.
quest.transport.planes.workbench.desc_2: For a list of how many propellors and how much wood is required, feel free to check the entries for the respective aircraft.
quest.transport.planes.propeller.title: Propeller
quest.transport.planes.propeller.desc_1: Propellers are required for all Simple Planes aircraft. They can be made using mechanical crafters.
quest.transport.planes.simpleaircraft.pl:
The most basic plane.
Seats 1(3 with upgrade)
Cannot hold any Supply Crates!

Materials Required:
1x Propeller
5x Wood Planks
quest.transport.planes.simpleaircraft.la:
As the name suggests, a large plane.
Seats 2 (4 with upgrade)
Can hold one Supply Crate, at the cost of a seat.

Materials Required:
1x Propeller
10x Wood Planks
quest.transport.planes.simpleaircraft.he:
A plane that goes up.
Seats 2 (4 with upgrade)
Can hold one Supply Crate, at the cost of a seat.

Materials Required:
2x Propeller
7x Wood Planks
quest.transport.planes.simpleaircraft.ca:
A massive cargo plane.
Seats 2 (5 with upgrade)
Can hold up to 8 Supply Crates.

Materials Required:
4x Propeller
64x Wood Planks
quest.transport.planes.ia_upgrades.title: Immersive Aircraft Upgrades
quest.transport.planes.ia_upgrades.desc_: Immersive Aircraft upgrades are split into two categories, Aircraft Weapons and Aircraft Upgrades.
Check the aircraft quests for a list of slots for each aircraft!
Upgrades can be installed by sitting in the aircraft and pressing [E].
quest.transport.planes.eco_engine.title: Eco Engine
quest.transport.planes.eco_engine.desc_1: The Eco Engine is an optional aircraft upgrade that changes the performance of your aircraft's engine.
quest.transport.planes.eco_engine.desc_2: Like all Immersive Aircraft upgrade, it takes up an upgrade slot!
quest.transport.planes.nether_engine.des: The Nether Engine is an optional aircraft upgrade that changes the performance of your aircraft's engine.
Like all Immersive Aircraft upgrade, it takes up an upgrade slot!

Weapon Slots: 1
Upgrade Slots: 1
Cargo Slots: 6
